Reviews.Title: “Excellent location close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: GregEva
Reviews.Content: A very clean and well organised/run establisment but much like a pensione in terms of the standards of the rooms. Breakfast was simple but good

Reviews.Title: “close to vatican an Tibor river.”
Reviews.Author: coinjack
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 days in early november prior tro going on a trans atlantic cruise in early november.This was our second visit to the domus having been there 5 years ago. The good points ,the rooms are larger then you would expect and very clean. The breakfast include d in price w as very good with lots of choices. The lobby and bar area is small but adaquate and is always staffed. The location is very good ,close to all busses and a 10 min walk to the subway. Good restaurants on Borgo Pio are a 3minute walk. We walked walked to just about everwherwas e . The rooftop garden is great for viewing St. Peter's and relaxing. The not so good points, can be noisy when tour buses come and go esp. in the am as people open and close the heavy doors to there rooms. The staff is friendly and helpful. The price was 130 euro per night for the two of us which I believe was a good value

Reviews.Title: “Good Handicap Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Señora
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay the nights of Nov. 1,2 and 3, 2011! I was using a wheel chair and a walker and found the room very well equipped for me. It was large enough for the wheel chair to fit in the door and move around the room. The bathroom was very large and had safety bars and a pull down plastic seat and movable shower head which worked very well for me to use. The glass doors on the shower opened up and the entrance to the shower was flat so that I could easily get in and out. There was a small elevator that I was able to use to get into the building. (I was told that a new one was being built with the new patio to access the main lobby area which would be more convenient.) The front desk people were very helpful and polite. The lounge was nice and access to WIFI good. The breakfast room and sleeping rooms were cheery and bright. The food was great! The rooftop patio was beautiful and had a fantastic view of St. Peter's Dome, Castel San Angelo and Maximilliano!!! We will definitely recommend Domus Carmelitana to any of our friends who visit Rome. It's only 6 blocks from the Vatican!

Reviews.Title: “Not to disappoint, another great trip............”
Reviews.Author: CKBergfin
Reviews.Content: This trip, my neice met mom and I at the hotel. Easy trip via shuttle, only about 30-45 mins depending on other hotel stops. We had a 3 bedroom room on 2nd floor, and a sitting area just outside the door. We spent a lot of time in this 'private' area-as no one else was around. Breakfast was full of choices and if you walked away hungry, it is your own fault. Views from the roof are not to be missed, especially at dusk. We did reserve tickets about 4 months ahead for the Scavi tour (accessible online for reservations), which was the highlight of the trip. Swiss guards at entrance are up close and personal. Also, took a city tour this time. Catch bus on street the vatican faces. It was great as mom has trouble with too much walking and wanted to see everything. Tour guide was great, got plenty of time to take pictures and see what was on the tour. Hadn't ever done this on this trip-but I recommend it even on long trips, and return to places you want to spend more time. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Vatican and Site seeing, Nice Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: KyanaLeg1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights of our pilgrimage and this property is literally a 5-10 minute walk to the Vatican. Its well located for site seeing of ancient Rome and all other kinds. Its right next to Borgo Pio where one can sit in any of the road side cafes and watch the pilgrims/tourists go by; or simply browse in the shops and get a Vatican bargain. The Food: Breakfast is a whole experience, the variety is geuinely great and one cannot say they were not catered for. even one of us with a medical condition got catered for, whether to their tastes is moot. Dinner was a 4 course affair, and the meals were fabulous. A choice would have been great because again we ate what we were given. The rooftop terrace is fabulous. one can watch Rome byu day/night up there and not ever want to go home. The Room: we got a room on the 3rd floor, and one of the problems we faced in our group was the Lift. The lifts kept getting out of sorts and taking people up n down or stopping at tyhe wrong floor. Also they are very slow. The room was okay, but looked like it hadnt got a good dusting for weeks. And didnt get it while we were there despite tyhe cleaners coming in on 2 seperate occasions. the shower was broken and it looked likemnit had been broken before we arrived dur to the mo0uld marks on the wallks and ceiling. That said the Bathroom is anple and has all one needs. Beware of the towels in Italy we got what we would consider table cloths for towels...Take your own. Staff: staff were quite okay and tied their best, but emglish is an issue for some and communication may be a bit of a problem there. Would I recommend the property, of course yes, esp if one is on a budget and wants to see as much of Rome/VAtican as they can without having to fork out for taxis everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value-10 mins to Vatican & museums-Very quiet and clean~”
Reviews.Author: CKBergfin
Reviews.Content: Reception staff very friendly and helpful, welcome expresso, great bonus. Room quiet, cold a/c. Hearty breakfast, beautiful views from rooftop, chapel connected to domus. Rooms comfy and clean. Close to museums, shops and Vatican. Best gelato 1/2 block away! Going back this May and bringing Mom! (has elevator if stairs are an issue). note: reservations for scavi tour needed 3-6 mos ahead of time. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “I won't go back. I went to Rome & The...”
Reviews.Author: Rilvo
Reviews.Content: I won't go back. I went to Rome & The Vatican with my family in the holy week. If you have come to Rome, you know that, in general, service standards for corresponding fees are far away of other cities and countries in general, but this one, is far below that parameter. I had issues with breakfast and frontdesk personnel regarding silly things but having really bad moments. The hotel is close to the Vatican and normal-clean standard ...and that's it. I am sure you can go to better options for the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but great”
Reviews.Author: TravellerCT
Reviews.Content: It is a simple hotel, but with great service, good food and wonderful location - all the major sites withing walking distance. I have stayed there 3 time already, and am looking forward to the next one.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Clean Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: brucegary
Reviews.Content: We selected this property for its reasonable charges, but we would have preferred a little less austere accommodations. It is not easy to find reasonably priced rooms in Rome, and after searching online and reading reviews, we picked Domus Carmelitana based on reports that it was clean and modern. Our room was clean but stark. The first thing to strike us when we got to our room was the sight of two very low twin cots on the tile foor. While the beds were comfortable, their height gave the appearance of a doll house. The bathroom was extremely small, and the very tiny cubicle that served as a shower had a slippery plastic drain board on the floor, which caused me to nearly lose my balance every time I showered. The included breakfast was very nice. Location is very convenient to walking to the Vatican (about 6 blocks) and there are nearby bus stops to take you to other parts of the city. Front desk staff was very helpful and gave good advice about using the busses. There are a large number of restaurants nearby between the hotel and the Vatican that are less than a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: jgulecas
Reviews.Content: Technically a religious house, rather than a conventional hotel per se. Very close to the Castel St. Angelo and a short walk to the Vatican. Beds were very narrow but quite comfortable. Rooms were clean and a/c worked well. Modern bathroom fixtures. Shower is American style with fixed showerhead, but stall is very tight. Rooms have very high ceilings. May have road noise if on side of building next to busy street. Our room was on other side and was very quiet. Wonderful european style continental breakfast, but with American coffee and orange juice. I actually miss having prosciutti and cheese on bread for breakfast now! Staff was wonderful and helpful. Not all spoke good English, but they always did the best they could!

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, choose Domus Carmelitana!”
Reviews.Author: nikica
Reviews.Content: When I was making plans for my trip to Rome with my son (9), I chose Domus Carmelitana mainly for it's excellent central location, less than 10 minutes from St Peter's. I was pleasently surprised when discovered that children pay only 50% of the price - a rare offer in Rome! I certainly recommend it to families with children. Domus Carmelitana is listed as a catholic guest house, but it is really a very cozy hotel, with moderate, but comfortable and modern rooms and a magnificent roof garden, where it seems that you can touch the dome of St. Peters cathedral with one hand, and Castel Sant'Angelo with the other. We also loved the view from our room - seeing Castel Sant'Angelo from our beds made us really feel in Rome. Breakfast was very copious and fresh and very tastefully presented. My son liked the satellite TV in the room and internet in the lobby. I liked the chapel. For people coming by car there is a lot of parking space in a private yard, and for all of us, impatient to explore the eternal city, there is a terminus stop of a very useful express bus line right around the corner. (It also gets you directly to the Termini Station in just 15 minutes or so). We will always remember our stay in Domus Carmelitana. It made our stay in Rome even more memorable. ... And it also taught my son (who loves ancient Rome and Romans) once and for all, that the Latin word "domus" is one of the very few nouns ending in -us that are not masculine but feminine; therefore, not "Domus Carmelitanus", but "Domus Carmelitana"!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, neat, quiet! Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: saraloma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Domus Carmelitana for 2 nights with my boyfrend and it was great! Super super clean, nice receptionist, good breakfast, and very centrally located. You can actually walk from it nearly anywere (specially Vatican, but also Piazza Navona, etc.). I would definately come back! Plus, the area is very very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Recent review”
Reviews.Author: jackatak23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Domus for 8 nights and it was wonderful. The rooms were clean and the facilities were terrific. The beautiful chapel and roof garden were lovely and my group and I enjoyed everything about our stay there. The receptionists at the desk were terrific-Paulo, Stefano, Massimo, and Alessandro were all so helpful and pleasant. I would certainly reccomend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “simple facility, rude reception”
Reviews.Author: frqttrvlr.
Reviews.Content: Stayed At Domus Carmelitana Dec. 24-26. The accomodation was average but we had a terrible time with the receptionist. On arrival, we were told to leave our passports <US passports>. The night before we left, we claimed our passport back but the receptionist could not find it. We were treated with disrespect, the receptionist was rude and he lacked communication skills. He argued with us but we suggested that he call the other receptionist, fortunately he found the passports in one of the locked cabinets. The receptionist never apologized, he remained proud and arrogant. We would have stayed again in this simple facility but I have zero tolerance for rudeness and disrespect especially for people working in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Haven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 day holiday in Rome and we stayed at the beautiful Domus Carmelitana. The rooms were clean and well kept. The air conditioning was a blessing as it was very hot in Rome while we were there. Our room faced a very quiet street and the windows and shutters did a good job blocking any outdoor sound. It was easy access to the bus transportation. This hotel is only three tenths of a mile from the Vatican and the view of St. Peter's Dome from the roof garden is a beautiful site. The staff was very helpful and spoke english very well. The breakfast, although not what we are used to as americans was very good. It was wonderful to come "home" to this beautiful haven at the end of a hectic day of site seeing, or in the middle of the day for a short rest and nap. We would definitely stay there again should we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A magical home in a vibrant city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For 13 days the Domus was my home. Wonderful, accomodating, cheerful and helpful staff -- Massimo and Paulo at reception were particularly helpful. Clean and refreshing atmosphere; quiet and respectful of guests. It was truly an anchor for a Roman Holday never to forget. Nine months later I close my eyes and walk out on Alberico II from the Domus and saunter through the city.

HotelInfo.Name: Domus Carmelitana
HotelInfo.Address: Via Alberico II, 44, 00193 Rome, Italy
